Magnificat anima mea Dominum: quia respexit humilitātem ancillae suae; ecce enim ex hōc beatam mē dīcent omnēs generātiōnēs
et exsultāvit spīritus meus in Deō salū: ^ because he hath regarded the humility of his handmaid; for behold from henceforth all generations shall call me blessed

Magnificat anima mea Dominum: quia fēcit mihi magna quī potens est
^ My soul doth magnify the Lord: et misericordia ejus in prōgeniēs et prōgeniēs timentibus eum. ^ because he that is mighty hath done great things to me
column5: and his mercy is from generation unto generations

et exsultāvit spīritus meus in Deō salū: dispersit superbōs mente cordis suī. ^ He hath shewed might in his arm
^ My soul doth magnify the Lord: he hath scattered the proud in the conceit of their heart.

et exsultāvit spīritus meus in Deō salū: et exaltāvit humilēs; ēsurientēs implēvit bonīs
^ My soul doth magnify the Lord: et dīvitēs dīmīsit inānēs. ^ He hath put down the mighty from their seat
and my spirit hath rejoiced in God my S: and hath exalted the humble; he hath filled the hungry with good things
column5: and the rich he hath sent empty away.

Magnificat anima mea Dominum: Suscepit Isrāēl puerum suum memorārī misericordiae
et exsultāvit spīritus meus in Deō salū: sīcut locutus est ad patrēs nostrōs
^ My soul doth magnify the Lord: Ābrahae et sēminī ejus in saeculā. ^ He hath received Israel his servant
column5: as he spoke to our fathers
column6: to Abraham and to his seed for ever.

et exsultāvit spīritus meus in Deō salū: quia vīsitāvit et fēcit redemptiōnem plebī suae
^ My soul doth magnify the Lord: ^ Blessed be the Lord God of Israel
and my spirit hath rejoiced in God my S: because he hath visited and wrought the redemption of his people

Magnificat anima mea Dominum: et ērēxit cornū salūtis nobīs in domō Dāvīdis puerī suī; ^ and hath raised up an horn of salvation to us
et exsultāvit spīritus meus in Deō salū: in the house of David his servant;

Magnificat anima mea Dominum: sīcut locutus est per ōs sanctōrum
et exsultāvit spīritus meus in Deō salū: quī ā saeculō sunt profetārum ejus
^ My soul doth magnify the Lord: ^ as he spoke by the mouth of his holy prophets

et exsultāvit spīritus meus in Deō salū: et dē manū omnium quī oderunt nōs; ad faciendam misericordiam cum patribus nostrīs
column5: and from the hand of all that hate us; to perform mercy to our fathers
column6: and to remember his holy testament

Magnificat anima mea Dominum: 8: jūsjūrandum quod jūrāvit ad Ābrahām patrem nostrum
and my spirit hath rejoiced in God my S: ^ the oath which he swore to Abraham our father
column5: that he would grant to us
column6: that being delivered from the hand of our enemies

et exsultāvit spīritus meus in Deō salū: in sanctitāte et justitiā cōram ipsō omnibus diēbus nostrīs. ^ we may serve him without fear
^ My soul doth magnify the Lord: in holiness and justice before him
profeta Altissimī vocāberis; praeībis enim ante faciem Dominī parāre viās ejus
column6: shalt be called the prophet of the Highest; for thou shalt go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways

Magnificat anima mea Dominum: 5: ad dandam scientiam salūtis plebī ejus in remissiōnem peccātōrum eōrum
et exsultāvit spīritus meus in Deō salū: per viscera misericordiae Deī nostrī;^ to give knowledge of salvation to his people
^ My soul doth magnify the Lord: unto the remission of their sins
and my spirit hath rejoiced in God my S: through the bowels of the mercy of our God;

Magnificat anima mea Dominum: 4: in quibus vīsitāvit nōs oriens ex altō; inlūmināre hīs quī in tenebrīs et in umbrā mortis sedent ^ whereby the orient from on high hath visited us; to enlighten them that sit in darkness and in the shadow of death;
3: ad dīrigendōs pedēs nostrōs in viam pācis. ^ to direct our feet into the way of peace.
2: Glōria Patrī et Fīliō et Spīrituī Sanctō
et exsultāvit spīritus meus in Deō salū: ^ Glory to the Father and to the Son and to the Holy Spirit
et in saecula saeculōrum. Āmen. ^ both now and ever
^ My soul doth magnify the Lord: and unto the ages of ages. Amen.
